attributes.action: The government should do more to improve student mental health
attributes.additional_details:
Websites: https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/anxiety-files/200804/how-big-problem-is-anxiety
https://www.nus.org.uk/en/news/20-per-cent-of-students-consider-themselves-to-have-a-mental-health-problem/
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/20/youth-mental-health-is-the-government-doing-enough
Quotes: 'Many people don’t realise that mental health, poverty, austerity and education are intertwined.' 'Nearly 25% of young people feel suicidal at least once in their lives.'
attributes.background: And anxiety has been increasing. The average secondary school child today has the same level of anxiety as the average psychiatric patient in the early 1950’s. We are getting more anxious every decade.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about students' mental health, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
